Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that provides file processing capabilities using Java NIO's FileChannel for efficient file operations including memory-mapped file access and direct buffer reading.

Class Description: FileChannelProcessor is a utility class that handles file operations using Java NIO's FileChannel. It supports memory-mapped file access (MappedByteBuffer) and direct buffer reading (ByteBuffer) with methods for opening/closing channels, mapping file segments, reading buffer segments, and finding line boundaries in buffers.

Attributes:
fileChannel: FileChannel - The FileChannel instance used for file operations
filePath: Path - The path to the file being processed
MAX_LINE_LENGTH: int (static final) - Maximum expected line length for boundary finding
MMAP_CHUNK_SIZE: int (static final) - Maximum size for memory-mapped file segments

Methods:
openChannel: void() throws IOException - Opens a read-only FileChannel for the specified file path
mapFileSegment: MappedByteBuffer(long start, long size) throws IOException - Maps a file segment into memory as a read-only MappedByteBuffer
readBufferSegment: ByteBuffer(long position, int length) throws IOException - Reads a file segment into a direct ByteBuffer
findLineBoundary: long(ByteBuffer buffer, long startPosition) - Finds the position of the next line boundary in a buffer
closeChannel: void() throws IOException - Closes the FileChannel if it's open
getFileSize: long() throws IOException - Returns the size of the file associated with the FileChannel
